H0.text: Vertically is the direction in which the rain would appear to fall to a person standing motionless on the Earth's surface on a day with no wind.

H1.text: Diagonally is the direction in which rain would appear to fall to a person standing motionless on the Earth's surface on a day with no wind.

H2.text: Horizontally is the direction the rain appears to fall to a person standing motionless on the Earth's surface on a day with no wind.

H3.text: Circularly is the direction in which the rain appears to fall for a person standing motionless on the Earth's surface on a day with no wind.

A4.text: Rain is a form of precipitation where water droplets that have condensed from atmospheric water vapor fall by gravity.
